website_summaries.verdict: This option is inexpensive, compact, and features a simple 2-switch operation.
pros: Comes with an LED light built into it
Self-locking feature keeps the jack from falling, even without power
cons: Does not come with a carrying case
Some reports that this model breaks fairly quickly and leaks hydraulic fluid

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed of the quality
customer_reviews.text: Broke and started leaking fluid and made a mess on the 3rd time use on a 1 ton Honda civic
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Leaked Oil
customer_reviews.text: The Jack lifted the car just fine. But started to leak oil.
customer_reviews.author: AMT-PHL

customer_reviews.title: Cord won't rear axle without extension.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on test but cut out on first lift. Restarted fine. Went down fine. Used on 2003 Chevy Silverado 4wd. You must get an extension to plug in to lighter for rear wheels of pickup truck. This is only reason I gave 4 stars. Also probably need a piece of wood to put under jack if you are on a dirt or sandy road. Good option for emergency tire change. Review by 67 year old woman.
customer_reviews.author: NativeTexan

customer_reviews.title: Wow!! Little pack of power...
customer_reviews.text: First time use try it on 3 different cars to make sure it handles what the product claims....So far it sock me and mostly my wife, She couldn't believe a product that small could do all the work it would take two men....Thank you...
customer_reviews.author: enrique gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: It works even better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this jack. It may be my favorite tool purchase in years! It fits very easily under my 1964 Thunderbird, which is very low to the ground. I like that the on-off switch stays in the on position, so you don't have to hold it. It sure beats using the old T-bird's bumper jack. It would be nice if it came with alligator clamps instead of a cigarette lighter plug, so it could be hooked directly to the battery. I bought a separate adapter to do just that.
customer_reviews.author: mrbfh

customer_reviews.title: small and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once but it picked up my 4WD 3700 pound truck, and on the heavy end. If you do need this you will only need it once, twice, how many flats do you get? But this beats the heck out of pumping up the little bottle jack or turning the handle on those scissor jacks while you are broke down in the dark and wet and dirty. There is nothing to it. push the button. [has a small footprint so find a board or something if you are in the mud.]
customer_reviews.author: DavidWCheney

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: worked great when i lifted the trailer. went to obtan parts( trailer was empty by the way), returned, big puddle of hydraulic fliid and a colapsed jack (only one I had at the time) find another jack.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: My X5 came with run-flat tires. I replaced them with REAL tires and realized I needed a spare, and a jack. This lifts that big car up high enough to change a tire and does it without breaking a sweat. I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: David Baertsch

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful little device
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful little device. It's compact and does exactly as advertised. It is also just as fast as a hand-crank jack
customer_reviews.author: B. Y. Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Works for a BMW F10
customer_reviews.text: My BMW F10 (2011 528i) came with run-flat tires, so I wanted to switch to regular tires. I bought this jack because it fits perfectly in the space under the trunk floor, so I can store it and take it along in case I have a flat tire. It seems to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael E. Caicedo

customer_reviews.title: Not a 3-Ton at all,  maybe a 2-Ton barely.
customer_reviews.text: It couldn't lift from the center of the axle on my Nissan Titan. I had to lift one wheel at a time, then place a Jack Stand under each wheel. It struggled to lift the center of a Hyundai Elantra 4-Door (2-Ton). This should NOT be rated for 3-Ton!
customer_reviews.author: E. Dub

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for each of my vehicles was so pleased with the first one so got a second. When you are along side of the road changing a tire and you jack handle bends and brakes in your hand its frustrating. can't happen to this jack.
customer_reviews.author: Art Railsback

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I'm disabled and can't twist a regular jack. It fits my 2015 Jeep Cherokee perfectly. I can get it under when the tire is completely flat and raise it to a hieght I can put on the spare without re-positioning the jack. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: crownvic5l

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: It had no problem lifting the front wheel of my Duramax truck at about 3K. Also has been holding up my rv wheel for several days now waiting on the replacement brake assy. It has a low profile & is much easier to use than a manual one. Excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Davignon

customer_reviews.title: It is in very good condition as described
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used from Amazon warehouse deals for $50. It is in very good condition as described. I tried it out on my F150 crew cab and it lifted it in less than 45 seconds with no problems at all. If it keeps working like this I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zexel

customer_reviews.title: great jack soooo easy to use but remember to raise ...
customer_reviews.text: great jack soooo easy to use but remember to raise the screw manually first and i like to use the optional battery connect rather then just the lighter socket
customer_reviews.author: door&dives

customer_reviews.title: Needs just a little bit of help to lift the bigger trucks.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2013 Ford F-150 Raptor. Big Tires. This did not lift the truck enough to change a tire by itself but in tandem with a scissor jack I got it high enough. This made it so much easier to raise the truck than just the scissor jack by itself. I do recommend this and will be using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great jack, easily operated.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate and effective for my truck, a full size pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. John

customer_reviews.title: Great product well made
customer_reviews.text: Worked as designed. During test it remain strong, No sign of break down. Delivered on time. Great product well made.
customer_reviews.author: Romero Dildy

customer_reviews.title: WORKS great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Happy I picked this up! Being almost 70, some things are not easy any more. Before this I was really not looking forward to a flat on the road! feal better now.
customer_reviews.author: B. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: It’s safe and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like the piston jack over a scissor jack. Scissor jack has little power when lifting from closed position.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nothing,just use it as prescribed
customer_reviews.text: I used it to jack up my trailer and put it on stands
customer_reviews.author: Charles J Donald

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: it died on me while i was jacking up my car, the shaft got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great for all purposes! Just need stands and can rebuild anything!
customer_reviews.author: paul t

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and strong!
customer_reviews.text: Workd great. Not low enough for a model 3. But works great to quickly lift my explorer to change a wheel. Much more portable and convenient than a hydraulic floor jack
customer_reviews.author: DFC

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Test was run on my 2005 Crown Victoria and item performed flawlessly. Very compact, taking up much less space than scissors jack. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: polisdad

customer_reviews.title: Had to return not as expected too noisy and slow
customer_reviews.text: Had to return not as expected too noisy and slow
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The light on the Jack is not working are these tested before sent out ?
customer_reviews.author: donald williams

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: simple to use, plenty strong to lift my 30' camp trailer, or my 3/4 ton pickup!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck D

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.text: It rose less than 1 inch, then it died. Never even made contact with the vehicle. But hey, the little LED light still works! $100 piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: jeni ross

product_meta.title: ABN 3 Ton Electric Hydraulic Jack – Automatic Emergency Lift for All Cars, Vans, Trucks, SUVs
feature_bullets: For Roadside Emergencies: The ABN 3 Ton Electric Hydraulic Jack is perfect for emergency use and includes a bright LED light so you can work virtually anywhere, anytime
Rated Capacity: 3 Ton (6,000 pounds) with lift range of 6 to 17.5 inches (155 to 450 millimeters)
Universal: Plugs into a 12V power outlet with a 11.5-foot (3.5-meter) cord that will reach all areas of your car, van, truck, or SUV
Easy to Operate: Simply flip the 2 switches - a vertical lift control switch and an LED light switch
Built-In Safety Device: Prevents the jack from falling and keeps a steady height even with no power

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars96 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
